wikipedia_page.main: Cyril Barnet Salmon, Baron Salmon PC (28 December 1903 – 7 November 1991) was a British judge.

link_mentions.page: List of British Jewish nobility and gentry

response: The letters are so called after Cyril Salmon, Baron Salmon who first conceived of the idea in 1966 when chairing a report into how tribunals of inquiry were to be conducted.
* Montague Salmon (1878-?), father of Cyril Salmon, Baron Salmon, judge
| Cyril Salmon, Baron Salmon, Lord of Appeal in Ordinary 1972-1980
